page.title: 09Bramhope: Local News
page.content: BRAMHOPE 2nd IN "BRITAIN IN BLOOM" COMPETITION{*}LOCAL N.C.H FETE RAISES Â£2000+{*}METHODIST MINISTER TO MARRY AND MOVE TO CORNWALL{*}MIDDLE SCHOOL P.T.A MEDIEVAL FAYRE RAISES Â£400{* ST. GILES CHURCH REACHES ORGAN REPAIRS TARGET{*}FIRST SCHOOL PUPIL WINS SCHOLARSHIP TO DURHAM CATHEDRAL{*}NEW BRAMHOPE VENTURE SCOUT UNIT OPENS{* AUSTRALIAN CRICKETERS STAY AT LOCAL HOTEL DURING TEST{*}BRAMHOPE GUIDES ATTEND CITY 75th G.G ANNIVERSARY{* SCHOOL OF DANCE ACHIEVES 100% SUCCESS IN EXAMS{*}LOCAL RESIDENT WARWICKSHIRE CRICKETER CHIS OLD OUT WITH SHOULDER INJURY{*}BRAMHOPE BRIDGE CLUB EXPANDS {*}PLAYGROUP VISITS CITY FARM{*}PURITAN CHAPEL SERVICE ON LOCAL RADIO/TV{* HEAVY ENROLMENT IN NIGHT SCHOOL WINE TASTING CLASSES{*}CAPTAIN'S ILLNESS CANCELS GUIDE CAMP{*}BRAMHOPE PLAYERS ENTER WHARFEDALE FESTIVAL.
